duties_responsibilities.duty: Assess the physical and mental condition of patients through comprehensive physical examinations and medical histories.
Order, collect, and interpret laboratory and diagnostic tests to evaluate patient problems and healthcare needs.
Prescribe, recommend, and employ medical drug therapies or other related therapeutic treatments and procedures, and recommend interventions to modify behavior associated with health risks.
Formulate and implement patient treatment plans based on assessments, evidence-based medicine, and collaboration with physicians and other interdisciplinary team members.
Counsel patients and families regarding medical processes, management of health illness, medication, nutrition, and health promotion.
Maintain appropriate records detailing patient treatment plans and outcomes, and initiate timely consultation and referral when necessary.
Provide consultation level services for conditions/problems related to the Provider’s specialty and training, and manage patients in healthcare settings beyond primary clinic setting.
Perform invasive procedures specific to scope of practice and competency as delegated by the supervising Physician.
May be required to perform patient care duties beyond regular schedule based on department coverage needs.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an Accredited Nurse Practitioner Program
Current license to practice as a Nurse Practitioner in the state of Texas
Basic Life Support (BLS) within 30 days of hire or transfer
Acute Care Certified from an accredited board for the patient population of focus
